definition: grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]
color/face/countenance
surname Yan

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Bai Yuping is looking at the husband of light up with pleasure, as if looking at a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 白玉萍望着喜笑顏開的丈夫，彷彿望着一個陌生人。

sentences.english: His face lit up with pleasure when she came in.
sentences.chinese: 當她進來時，他馬上喜笑顏開。

sentences.english: Looking at the grain piled high in the courtyard , the whole family were wreathed in smiles.
sentences.chinese: 看着院子裏堆成山的糧食，全家人都喜笑顏開。

sentences.english: As soon as the old man sees his grandchild his face lights up.
sentences.chinese: 老人一見到孫子就喜笑顏開的。

sentences.english: His face lit up with pleasure when news came that his essay had won first prize.
sentences.chinese: 聽說他的文章獲得了一等獎，他喜笑顏開。

sentences.english: Memories cgreabout make you smile sometimes likewise cry sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 回憶，有時令你嘴角上揚，也能讓你喜笑顏開。

sentences.english: She smiled at me on the subway.
sentences.chinese: 在那地下鐵，她對我喜笑顏開。
